faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The course with lectures, labs and seminars is focused on main issues of medical biophysics.
description.et: Loengutes, praktikumides ja seminarides tutvustatakse meditsiinile orienteeritud biofüüsika olulisemaid teoreetilisi teemasid ja uurimismeetodeid

objectives.en: This course helps to understand the biophysical basis of functioning of the human body, describes the use of different measuring devices to assess functions of the organism and explains how to present the results in graphical form.
objectives.et: Kursus tutvustab inimorganismi funktsioneerimise biofüüsikalisi aluseid ja kirjeldab erinevate mõõteseadmete kasutamist organismi talitluse hindamiseks ning saadud tulemuste graafilist kujutamist.

learning_outcomes.en:
After completing this course the student should be able to:
- understand the language of equations, that means the ability to interpret the relationships in these equations,
- use basic experimental devices for measurements, 
- construct and read graphs with the results from the measurements
- describe basic concepts of mechanics, fluid physics, electricity, optics, thermodynamics and radiation physics, and connect those with principles of human physiology and diagnostic measurement devices.
learning_outcomes.et:
Kursuse läbinud tudeng:
-on suuteline aru saama valemite keelest, st interpreteerima, millised on nendes esitatud sõltuvused.
-on suuteline tegema mõõtmisi ettevalmistatud katseseadmetega, lugema ja koostama graafikuid
-tunneb mehaanika, vedelikufüüsika, elektrinähtuste, optika, termodünaamika ja kiirgusfüüsika põhilisi seaduspärasusi ning oskab neid seostada inimorganismi ja diagnostikaseadmete funktsioneerimise põhimõtetega.

description.et: A written test about general physics gives up to 30% and online quizzes about general physics will give up to 10% of the final result.

A written exam consists of graph questions and of  longer essay questions about special parts of biophysics (these can give up to 60% of the final result). 
Grades from A to E are positive grades, in case of F you have failed. Grades will be given as following: 
A 91-100 %, B 81-90 %, C 71-80 %, D 61-70 %, E 51-60 %, F 0 -50% of points.

grade_preconditions.et: All practical sessions have to be done in order to attend the final exam.

grade_evaluation.et: 40% of points come from a written test and online quizzes on general physics, 60% of points - from the final exam on special part.

debt_elimination.et: There are 3 possibilities to make the final exam, the exact dates can be found from SIS.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

weeks.et: Weeks 1-16 (2 hours of lectures every week, 3 hours of group work every other week)

description.et: EXACT TIMETABLE AND OTHER RESOURCES FOR THE BIOPHYSICS COURSE CAN BE FOUND FROM MOODLE
There are 14 lectures in this course, more details in Moodle
There are 8 practical classes, more details in Moodle
